errors.error_description: The installation steps for installing from source are in the wrong order. The user is instructed to run `pip install -e .` before cloning the repository, which will fail because the source code is not yet present.
correction_candidates: First, clone the repository with `git clone https://github.com/PyDMD/PyDMD`, then install the package with `pip install -e .`.
First, install the package with `pip install pydmd`, then clone the repository with `git clone https://github.com/PyDMD/PyDMD`.
First, download the source as a ZIP file, then run `pip install PyDMD-master.zip`.
First, clone the repository with `git clone https://github.com/PyDMD/PyDMD` and then run `python setup.py install`.
errors.golden_answer: First, clone the repository with `git clone https://github.com/PyDMD/PyDMD`, then install the package with `pip install -e .`.

errors.error_description: The README incorrectly states that PyDMD requires Python 2.7, which is outdated. The package supports modern Python 3 versions, as indicated by the badge.
correction_candidates: Note: PyDMD is compatible with Python 3.6 and higher.
The Python version requirement should be removed as `pip` handles it automatically.
Note: PyDMD is only compatible with Python 3.10.
Note: PyDMD is compatible with both Python 2.7 and Python 3.x.
errors.golden_answer: The Python version requirement should be removed as `pip` handles it automatically.
